author: Albert Ellis
quote: You mainly feel the way you think.

author: Carl Jung
quote: What you resist, persists; What you accept, transforms

author: Wayne Dyer
quote: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.

author: Eric Butterworth
quote: Things may happen around you, and things may happen to you, but the only things that matter are the things that happen in you.

author: Viktor Frankl
quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.

author: Viktor Frankl
quote: What man actually needs is not a tensionless state but rather the striving and struggling for some goal worthy of him.

author: Adam Grant
quote: Happiness is being content with the path you chose, instead of wondering what might have been, and making others happier.

author: Shamash Alidina
quote: Confidence isn't having no fears; confidence is gently moving towards your fears to live the life you wish to live.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Confine yourself to the present.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Each day provides its own gifts.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The best answer to anger is silence.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Misfortune nobly born is good fortune.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Give yourself a gift, the present moment.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You can commit injustice by doing nothing.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: How trivial the things we want so passionately are.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Conceal a flaw, and the world will imagine the worst.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Remember that very little is needed to make a happy life.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: I cannot escape death, but at least I can escape the fear of it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: If it is not right, do not do it, if it is not true, do not say it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Have I been made for this, to lie under the blankets and keep myself warm?

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The only wealth which you will keep forever is the wealth you have given away.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: How ridiculous and how strange to be surprised at anything which happens in life.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Settle on the type of person you want to be and stick to it, whether alone or in company.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Love the hand that fate deals you and play it as your own, for what could be more fitting?

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Choose not to be harmed - and you won’t feel harmed. Don’t feel harmed – and you haven’t been.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Consider at what price you sell your integrity, but please, for God’s sake, don’t sell it cheap.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: External things are not the problem. It’s your assessment of them. Which you can erase right now.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: It never ceases to amaze me: we all love ourselves more than other people, but care more about their opinion than our own.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive – to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Think of the life you have lived until now as over and, as a dead man, see what’s left as a bonus and live it according to Nature.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Put from you the belief that 'I have been wronged', and with it will go the feeling. Reject your sense of injury, and the injury itself disappears.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: If anyone can refute me – show me I’m making a mistake or looking at things from the wrong perspective–I’ll gladly change. It’s the truth I’m after, and the truth never harmed anyone.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: In your actions, don’t procrastinate. In your conversations, don’t confuse. In your thoughts, don’t wander. In your soul, don’t be passive or aggressive. In your life, don’t be all about business.

author: Seneca
quote: Hurry up and live.

author: Seneca
quote: He who is brave is free.

author: Seneca
quote: Ignorance is the cause of fear.

author: Seneca
quote: To be everywhere is to be nowhere.

author: Seneca
quote: While we wait for life, life passes.

author: Seneca
quote: Life, if well lived, is long enough.

author: Seneca
quote: Only time can heal what reason cannot.

author: Seneca
quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.

author: Seneca
quote: Life is long, if you know how to use it.

author: Seneca
quote: While we are postponing, life speeds by.

author: Seneca
quote: Cease to hope and you will cease to fear.

author: Seneca
quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.

author: Seneca
quote: Difficulty comes from our lack of confidence.

author: Seneca
quote: To wish to be well is a part of becoming well.

author: Seneca
quote: Bestow pardon for many things; seek pardon for none.

author: Seneca
quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.

author: Seneca
quote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.

author: Seneca
quote: Wealth is the slave of a wise man and the master of a fool.

author: Seneca
quote: It is more civilized to make fun of life than to bewail it.

author: Seneca
quote: If a man knows not which port he sails, no wind is favorable.

author: Seneca
quote: He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a man who is alive.

author: Seneca
quote: What really ruins our character is the fact that none of us looks back over his life.

author: Seneca
quote: It does not matter how many books you have, but how good are the books which you have.

author: Seneca
quote: For many men, the acquisition of wealth does not end their troubles, it only changes them.

author: Seneca
quote: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms, you will be able to use them better when you are older.

author: Seneca
quote: Life is very short and anxious for those who forget the past, neglect the present, and fear the future.

author: Seneca
quote: When a person spends all his time in foreign travel, he ends by having many acquaintances, but no friends.

author: Seneca
quote: It’s not because things are difficult that we dare not venture. It’s because we dare not venture that they are difficult.

author: Seneca
quote: This is our big mistake: to think we look forward to death. Most of death is already gone. Whatever time has passed is owned by death.

author: Seneca
quote: Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is and pass some time in his own company.

author: Seneca
quote: No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don’t have, and to cheerfully put to good use what they do have.

author: Seneca
quote: People are frugal in guarding their personal property; but as soon as it comes to squandering time they are most wasteful of the one thing in which it is right to be stingy

author: Seneca
quote: I judge you unfortunate because you have never lived through misfortune. You have passed through life without an opponent–no one can ever know what you are capable of, not even you.

author: Seneca
quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing

author: Epictetus
quote: No great thing is created suddenly.

author: Epictetus
quote: It is difficulties that show what men are.

author: Epictetus
quote: You become what you give your attention to.

author: Epictetus
quote: If you want something good, get it yourself.

author: Epictetus
quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.

author: Epictetus
quote: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.

author: Epictetus
quote: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.

author: Epictetus
quote: Know, first, who you are, and then adorn yourself accordingly.

author: Epictetus
quote: A ship should not ride on a single anchor, nor life on a single hope.

author: Epictetus
quote: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?

author: Epictetus
quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.

author: Epictetus
quote: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.

author: Epictetus
quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

author: Epictetus
quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.

author: Epictetus
quote: The origin of sorrow is this: to wish for something that does not come to pass.

author: Epictetus
quote: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.

author: Epictetus
quote: Curb your desire–don’t set your heart on so many things and you will get what you need.

author: Epictetus
quote: It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.

author: Epictetus
quote: Men are disturbed not by things but by the principles and notions which they form concerning things.

author: Epictetus
quote: Where do I look for good and evil? Not to uncontrollable externals, but within myself to the choices that are my own.

author: Epictetus
quote: As time passes we forget what we learned and end up doing the opposite, and hold opinions the opposite of what we should

author: Epictetus
quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.

author: Epictetus
quote: Don’t seek for everything to happen as you wish it would, but rather wish that everything happens as it actually will–then your life will flow well.

author: Epictetus
quote: Think of yourself as a wrestler whom God, like a trainer, has paired with a tough young buck. For what purpose? To turn you into Olympic-class material.

author: Zeno
quote: Extravagance is its own destroyer.

author: Zeno
quote: All the good are friends of one another.

author: Zeno
quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.

author: Zeno
quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue

author: Zeno
quote: Steel your sensibilities, so that life shall hurt you as little as possible.

author: Zeno
quote: A bad feeling is a commotion of the mind repugnant to reason, and against nature.

author: Zeno
quote: No loss should be more regrettable to us than losing our time, for it’s irretrievable.

author: Musonius Rufus
quote: Since every man dies, it is better to die with distinction than to live long.

author: Musonius Rufus
quote: Humanity must seek what is NOT simple and obvious using the simple and obvious.

author: Musonius Rufus
quote: Thus whoever destroys human marriage destroys the home, the city – the whole human race.

author: Musonius Rufus
quote: We begin to lose our hesitation to do immoral things when we lose our hesitation to speak of them.

author: Musonius Rufus
quote: Only by exhibiting actions in harmony with the sound words which he has received will anyone be helped by philosophy.

author: Musonius Rufus
quote: If you accomplish something good with hard work, the labor passes quickly, but the good endures, if you do something shameful in pursuit of pleasure, the pleasure passes quickly, but the shame endures

author: Diogenes
quote: Blushing is the color of virtue.

author: Diogenes
quote: The mob is the mother of tyrants.

author: Diogenes
quote: Poverty is a virtue which one can teach oneself.

author: Diogenes
quote: He with the most who is content with the least.

author: Diogenes
quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.

author: Diogenes
quote: I am not an Athenian or a Greek, but a citizen of the world.

author: Diogenes
quote: Dogs and philosophers do the greatest good and get the fewest rewards.

author: Cato
quote: In doing nothing men learn to do evil.

author: Cato
quote: Don't promise twice what you can do at once.

author: Cato
quote: Old age isn't so bad when you consider the alternatives.

author: Cato
quote: Bitter are the roots of study, but how sweet their fruit.

author: Cato
quote: Consider it the greatest of all virtues to restrain the tongue.

author: Cato
quote: The best way to keep good acts in memory is to refresh them with new.

author: Cato
quote: I begin to speak only when I’m certain what I’ll say isn’t better left unsaid.

author: Cicero
quote: Let your desires be ruled by reason.

author: Cicero
quote: Not for ourselves alone are we born.

author: Cicero
quote: We must not say every mistake is a foolish one.

author: Cicero
quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all others.

author: Heraclitus
quote: You could not step twice into the same river.

author: Cleanthes
quote: Fate guides the willing, but drags the unwilling.

author: Chrysippus
quote: There could be no justice, unless there were also injustice, no courage, unless there were cowardice, no truth, unless there were falsehood.

author: Henry Ford
quote: Failure is only the opportunity to begin again. Only this time, more wisely

author: Gautama Buddha
quote: Peace comes from within.  Do not seek it without

author: Gautama Buddha
quote: If you truly loved yourself, you could never hurt another

author: Gautama Buddha
quote: Every morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most

author: Gautama Buddha
quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger

author: Gautama Buddha
quote: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path

author: Gautama Buddha
quote: Whatever a person frequently thinks and reflects on, that will become the inclination of their mind.

author: Gautama Buddha
quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else, you are the one who gets burned

author: Gautama Buddha
quote: If you cling to your wealth, it is better to throw it away than to let it poison your heart. But if you don’t cling to it but use it wisely, then you will be a blessing to people. It’s not wealth and power that enslave people, but the clinging to wealth and power

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: Love is the absence of judgment

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: Know the rules well, so you can break them effectively

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: Judge your success by what you had to give up in order to get it

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: We can never obtain peace in the outer world until we make peace with ourselves

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: A truly compassionate attitude toward others does not change even if they behave negatively or hurt you

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: Only the development of compassion and understanding for others can bring us the tranquility and happiness we all seek

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: All suffering is caused by ignorance. People inflict pain on others in the selfish pursuit of their own happiness or satisfaction

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote: People take different roads seeking fulfillment and happiness. Just because they’re not on your road doesn’t mean they’ve gotten lost

author: Eckhart Tolle
quote: The beginning of freedom is the realization that you are not your thoughts

author: Winnifred Wygal
quote: Father, give us courage to change what must be altered, serenity to accept what cannot be helped, and the insight to know the one from the other.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: There but for the grace of God go I

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: The only thing ever achieved in life without effort is failure

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Do few things but do them well, simple joys are holy

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: A single sunbeam is enough to drive away many shadows

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Remember that when you leave this earth, you can take with you nothing that have received--only what you have given

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: True progress quietly and persistently moves along without notice

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: A single sunbeam is enough to drive away many shadows

author: St. John of the Cross
quote: Love consists not in feeling great things but in having great detachment and in suffering for the Beloved

author: St. John of the Cross
quote: In the twilight of life, God will not judge us on our earthly possessions and human success, but rather on how much we have loved

author: St. John of the Cross
quote: It is great wisdom to know how to be silent and to look at neither the remarks, nor the deeds, nor the lives of others

author: St. John of the Cross
quote: Do not let your eye be drawn by the false beacons of wealth, or position, or fame, or possessions. Be vigilant over your will and desires, for these are the corrupt forces that dwell within, and keep you from living free

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
quote: The mind commands the body and it obeys. The mind orders itself and meets resistance

author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
quote: What we love we shall grow to resemble

author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
quote: The three most important virtues are humility, humility, and humility

author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
quote: God will either give us what we ask, or what He knows to be better for us

author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
quote: We find rest in those we love, and we provide a resting place in ourselves for those who love us

author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
quote: Many often err and accomplish little or nothing because they try to become learned rather than to live well

author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
quote: A saint is not someone who never sins, but one who sins less and less frequently and gets up more and more quickly

author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
quote: You will find something far greater in the woods than in books. Stones and trees will teach you that which you cannot learn from the masters

author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
quote: Spiritual life is like living water that springs up from the very depths of our own spiritual experience. In spiritual life everyone has to drink from his or her own well

author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
quote: If then you are wise, you will show yourself rather as a reservoir than as a canal. For a canal spreads abroad water as it receives it, but a reservoir waits until it is filled before overflowing, and thus communicates, without loss to itself, its superabundant water

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: Beware the man of a single book

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: Wonder is the desire of knowledge

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: The things that we love tell us what we are

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: Happiness is secured through virtue; it is a good attained by man's own will

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: If the highest aim of a captain were to preserve his ship, he would keep it in port forever

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: The greatest kindness one can render to any man consists in leading him from error to truth

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: The principal act of courage is to endure and withstand dangers doggedly rather than to attack them.

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: Fear is such a powerful emotion for humans that when we allow it to take us over, it drives compassion right out of our hearts

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: We must love them both, those whose opinions we share and those whose opinions we reject, for both have labored in the search for truth, and both have helped us in finding it

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: Because of the diverse conditions of humans, it happens that some acts are virtuous to some people, as appropriate and suitable to them, while the same acts are immoral for others, as inappropriate to them.

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Love between man and woman cannot be built without sacrifices and self-denial

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Freedom consists not in doing what we like, but in having the right to do what we ought

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Social justice cannot be attained by violence. Violence kills what it intends to create

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Do not be afraid. Do not be satisfied with mediocrity. Put out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Science can purify religion from error and superstition. Religion can purify science from idolatry and false absolutes.

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Love consists of a commitment which limits one's freedom - it is a giving of the self, and to give oneself means just that: to limit one's freedom on behalf of another

author: Pope Francis I
quote: To be saints is not a privilege for a few, but a vocation for everyone

author: Pope Francis I
quote: The Lord never tires of forgiving. It is we who tire of asking for forgiveness

author: Pope Francis I
quote: Holiness doesn’t mean doing extraordinary things, but doing ordinary things with love and faith

author: Pope Francis I
quote: The confessional is not a torture chamber, but the place in which the Lord's mercy motivates us to do better

author: Pope Francis I
quote: Human dignity is the same for all human beings: when I trample on the dignity of another, I am trampling on my own

author: Pope Francis I
quote: Although the life of a person is in a land full of thorns and weeds, there is always a space in which the good seed can grow

author: Pope Francis I
quote: Each of us has a vision of good and of evil. We have to encourage people to follow the good and fight evil as he conceives them. That would be enough to make the world a better place

author: Iroh
quote: Life happens wherever you are, whether you make it or not

author: Iroh
quote: There is nothing wrong with a life of peace and prosperity

author: Iroh
quote: Sharing tea with a fascinating stranger is one of life's true delights.

author: Iroh
quote: The best tea tastes delicious whether it comes in a porcelain pot or a tin cup.

author: Iroh
quote: Good times become good memories, but bad times become good lessons

author: Iroh
quote: Sometimes the best way to solve your own problems is to help someone else

author: Iroh
quote: Pride is not the opposite of shame, but it's source. True humility is the only antidote to shame

author: Iroh
quote: You will find that if you look for the light, you can often find it, but if you look for the dark, that is all you will ever see

author: Iroh
quote: In the darkest times, hope is something you give yourself. That is the meaning of inner strength

author: Iroh
quote: Sometimes life is like this dark tunnel. You can't always see the light at the end of the tunnel, but if you just keep moving, you will come to a better place

author: Guru Pathik
quote: The greatest illusion of this world is the illusion of separation. Things you think are separate and different are actually one and the same… We are all one people, but we live as if divided.

author: Caduceus Clay
quote: Its important not to get angry at people for what they don’t know

author: Caduceus Clay
quote: People aren’t good. Things that you do are good, or bad, but people are just people

author: Caduceus Clay
quote: That's the trick with faith: if you aren't willing to move forward until you know, then you don't need it

author: Caduceus Clay
quote: Eventually, some day, somebody will pray for a miracle, pray for something to save them, to whatever gods are nearby, and that prayer will be answered because you’ll show up

author: Fjord
quote: Sometimes it's just hard figuring out who you should be, instead of who you want to be

author: Queen Galadriel
quote: Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.

author: Gandalf
quote: Many that live deserve death. Some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them, Frodo? Do not be too eager to deal out death in judgment. Even the very wise cannot see all ends.

author: Gandalf
quote: Despair is only for those who see the end beyond all doubt. We do not.

author: Gandalf
quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.

author: Aragorn
quote: Deeds will not be less valiant because they are unpraised.

author: Frank Herbert
quote: The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.

author: Frank Herbert
quote: It is impossible to live in the past, difficult to live in the present and a waste to live in the future

author: Frank Herbert
quote: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me
